description: Introduction to the core question of user privacy on the web, setting the theme for the video
quote: Are you the product? Not in the metaphysical sense... who profits when you browse the web.

description: Explanation of how DNS leaks domain information to ISPs despite HTTPS encryption
quote: Your ISP hears every one of those questions... which domains did you ask for, when, and how often.

description: Key revelation that VPNs do not significantly improve privacy against ISPs
quote: For most day-to-day web browsing at home, a consumer VPN is almost pointless as a privacy measure.

description: Introduction to encrypted DNS as an effective privacy solution
quote: encrypted DNS, or specifically DOH, or DNS over HTTPS, and DNS over TLS, or DOT.

description: Practical advice on implementing secure DNS settings across devices
quote: On Windows 11, you can set secure DNS in the network settings and choose a known resolver.

description: Conclusion emphasizing user control over DNS to reduce being 'the product'
quote: Change that one setting and the product on the shelf becomes just service again.
